info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Wallace and south central Sherman Counties through 1015 PM MDT... At 929 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles northwest of Sharon Springs, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northern Wallace and south central Sherman Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
